title: Palantir Gets Partial Win in Fight With Ex-Workers at AI Startup
description: A judge agreed with Palantir Technologies Inc. that a trio of former employees likely violated confidentiality and non-solicitation agreements in founding their artificial intelligence startup but stopped short of halting their work at the new company, Percepta.

title: "Nice framing on AI, moving from tech subject to public policy issue": Tony Blair Institute Country Director Vivek Agarwal on AI Summit
description: Country Director India at the Tony Blair Institute, Vivek Agarwal, hailed the AI Impact Summit 2026, saying that the Centre has moved the conversation around artificial intelligence from being a technology subject to a public policy issue.

title: Wall St ends higher on Nvidia, other AI stocks
description: Wall Street ended higher on Wednesday, lifted by gains in Nvidia, Amazon and other technology-related heavyweights following recent jitters about artificial intelligence.
content:

title: Defense Department and Anthropic Square Off in Dispute Over A.I. Safety
description: How artificial intelligence will be used in future battlefields is an issue that has turned increasingly political and may put Anthropic in a bind.
content:
For months, the Department of Defense and the artificial intelligence company Anthropic have been negotiating a contract over the use of A.I. on classified systems by the Pentagon.
This week, those discussions erupted in a war of words.
On Monday, a ... [1002 chars]

title: India well positioned to be leader in AI: Rishi Sunak
description: NEW DELHI, Feb 18 : Supported by a deep talent pool and strong digital public infrastructure, India is well positioned to be a leader in AI and demonstrate its mass adoption and deployment in society, former British prime minister Rishi Sunak said on Wednesday. At an interactive session during the ongoing AI Impact Summit here, Sunak also said there are different attitudes towards artificial intelligence (AI) around the world, and in India, there is “incredible optimism and trust”, whereas in […]

title: India, UK conduct scale-up study of AI-enabled mental health tool for young girls
description: LONDON, Feb 18 :  Researchers from India and the UK are collaborating on a new 5.3 million pounds project to adapt and scale-up an artificial intelligence (AI) enabled digital mental health programme for adolescent girls living in Indian villages. The international project, unveiled to coincide with the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi this week, involves partners from Imperial College London,Â University of Cambridge, Tata Institute of Social Sciences and Milaan Foundation, alongside community-based organisations.
